Job DescriptionWe are seeking a Project Manager who will provide project management support to CMC Leaders and CMC teams:

As a member of the CMC (Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Controls) team (sub-team of CDT), works with the team and with PDMS (Pharmaceutical Development and Manufacturing Science) functions to facilitate successful project execution, achievement of key deliverables and of budget and FTE goals.
As a member of the Project Management Team (PMT) representing PDMS, supports cross-functional planning, budgeting, and resourcing activities.

Provide CMC Team support by managing and facilitating Teams as agreed upon by CMC LeaderBuilding project timelinesDeveloping and analyzing scenarios, risk assessment, and mitigation planningDeveloping project budgetsDevelop and manage Team resource (FTE) needs in collaboration with PDMS functionsManaging critical pathTeam governance supportSupport monthly, quarterly and major financial budget cycles, including the development of business plan budgets and FTE's

Primary Duties

An active member of assigned CMC teams.

Team facilitation & managementTranslate strategies into PDMS (CMC) operational plansMaintain project plans and monitor critical pathStakeholder managementSupport risk management and mitigationDevelop OOPs and FTE forecastsLiaise with project finance, program management and customer groups from the therapeutic areas and operational departments

Education

Bachelors Degree in Scientific Discipline (Masters Degree preferred).

Project Management Professional(PMP) or other related certification is desirable

Experience

Minimum of 7 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry and drug development is requiredKnowledge of Pharmaceutical Development CMC/PDMS is requiredExperience in Project Management is a mustA small molecule, large molecule and/or vaccine development experience is preferredClinical Development a plusKnowledge of project management tools and techniques, experience in Planisware is a plus

Critical Competencies

CommunicationInterdependent partneringCustomer focusCollaboration and teamingResults and performance driven

The Vice President role is a general management position in which you ll run and grow a profitable Red Ventures business.
We put big company resources behind fast growing and agile smaller businesses, giving our leaders the unique opportunity to behave entrepreneurially without having to be entrepreneurs.
In this role, you ll support one or more of our businesses in a variety of industries including home services, financial services, or healthcare.
Our interview process is designed to determine the right placement for our candidates as we are looking for leaders across a variety of different teams.

Own daily operational responsibilities for one of Red Ventures  rapidly growing business units including full P&L management

You ll make decisions that affect all critical aspects of your business from sales operations, marketing, financial management, partnerships or even the launch of a new business

You ll do more than consult   you ll immerse yourself in one of our businesses and drive daily performance, develop solutions and see them through as they are implemented

Develop and lead teams including marketing, creative, and technology

Optimize each stage of our demand generation touch points and sales center operations through data analysis

Collaborate closely with marketing partners to identify opportunities to optimize offers and response rates to maximize profit contribution

Brainstorm, validate, test and refine customer acquisition initiatives utilizing A/B split testing to ensure ongoing improvements

Minimal travel required   0-10%

What We re Looking For

10+ years of business experience with a strong track record of success.

Many successful VPs come from top consulting firms, investment banks, or private equity firms potentially followed by experience in industry

A Bachelor s degree, typically in an analytically oriented discipline (e.g. business, economics, statistics, mathematics, etc.)
or technology oriented discipline (e.g. computer science, MIS, etc.)

While an MBA is not required, many candidates have likely earned an MBA from a top-tier program and have a track record of success in strategic development and execution of business operations

Experience with in-depth analytics and problem solving, the ability to think strategically while being detail and execution-oriented, and success in managing competing priorities

High emotional IQ and ability to think quickly on your feet.
VPs are expected to develop & cultivate strong relationships with multiple external partners.

Strong leader and developer of talent

Comfort in a fast-paced and often changing environment

Our employees behave like entrepreneurs.
They are incredibly driven, agile, goal oriented, and are always up for a challenge.
A sense of humor!

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



Manages the employment process in a branch location, including hiring, training and performance management of staff and authorization of personnel and salary actions.
Assists in establishing performance standards and sales goals.
Guides employee development efforts, coaches, mentors and defines training needs.
Keeps branch employees focused on Customer Service Delivery.
Collects statistics and analyzes data regarding customer sales trends and patterns, and makes recommendations for maximizing effectiveness of service delivery channels.
Works with business line management to analyze service and staffing levels and to identify repeat customer service.
Safeguards cash assets and inventory in branch locations by implementing accounting and branch operations policies and procedures.
Monitors all cash flow.
Prepares various periodic reports to provide information for financial decision-making.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree preferred.
A minimum of three years' progressively more responsible supervisory experience required, preferably in a sales, service or retail environment.
Prior management experience required.
Familiarity with business practices and accounting principles strongly preferred.
Strong leadership and mentoring skills required.
AAA Northeast is one of the largest and most innovative membership organizations in North America.
It is a multi-business organization comprising more than 60 locations in a six-state area.

We provide valuable roadside service to our 5.1 million members, as well as many specialized services such as Financial Services & Loans, Insurance, Travel, Discounts, Auto Glass, and Driver Training.
AAA is a key advocate for issues impacting the traveling public, such as highway safety, road maintenance and related legislation.
We have a unique organizational model and many of our businesses are the largest and most sought after in their industries.
AAA Northeast employees help and serve as a way of life.
Through a 100-year legacy of service stewardship, our employees make valuable contributions to our workplace and the community that surrounds us.
In order to continue our mission, our organization is expanding and we need talented people to work alongside us in creating our next 100 years.

L3 Space & Sensors is a division of L3 Technologies and we are located in Cincinnati's northern suburb of Mason, Ohio.
Our Space & Sensors business has an impressive history and is an established pioneer in space exploration and defense technology.
We are a Center of Excellence and world renowned for our expertise in the areas of infrared detection and space avionics.
It's no wonder we are consistently named in Fortune's 500 listing.

At L3 you will have the opportunity to work with highly recognized engineering and manufacturing teams who are engaged in the design, development, and building of highly-sophisticated electronics equipment that are used in a variety of defense and commercial applications.
We are currently seeking a Test Technician 3.
We are currently seeking a Test Technician to contribute to the success of our Space Division.
Individuals in this position will perform electrical test of CCA's and system level units.
This position will be on a 9/80 1st Shift work schedule of Monday - Friday.

Responsibilities of this position will include:



Perform Acceptance tests on various products.
Understand and follow appropriate test equipment / safety procedures.
Maintain product configuration information in appropriate documents.
Support the troubleshooting and rework/repair systems and/or their subassemblies.
Maintain troubleshooting documentation in appropriate process / product documents.
Support completion of assembly operations to meet delivery expectations.
Tack solder "select at test" components.
Identify ways to improve current production processes and communicate ideas with appropriate personnel.
Maintain current status of units being processed.

Other duties as assigned


Qualifications / Requirements:



Associate's Degree in a technical or engineering field.
Minimum of 5 years' experience testing electronics.

Technical knowledge and skills in troubleshooting down to the component level; solid understanding and working knowledge of test equipment such as multimeters, oscilloscopes, power supplies, thermal chambers, etc.
Analog and digital troubleshooting skills are a plus.

Environmental testing is a plus
Basic computer skills including familiarity with Excel.
Strong written and interpersonal skills, such as communicating well with customers, management, engineering and manufacturing as well as other disciplines of the organization.
Strong planning/organizational skills with ability to prioritize work assignments.
Ability to work individually and in a team oriented environment.

Our employees enjoy a generous benefit package which includes the following:



Competitive Pay
9/80 Work Schedule (with every other Friday off)
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
Health Savings Plans
Life and Disability Insurance Plans
Retirement Savings Plans
Paid Time Off
Various Voluntary Benefits


L3 is a publicly held company traded under the LLL symbol.
We have over 75 locations globally with more than 30,000 employees whose primary focus is on keeping our nation safe.
Our high standards and aggressive growth goals also mean that our employees are eligible for numerous career advancement opportunities.

L3 is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V and we make all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Job DescriptionManufacturing Engineer

Grand Rapids, MI

Ongoing Contract/Possibility of Direct-Hire

Competitive Rate Available

Inspired by over 100 years of insight, our client, the world s largest international office furniture manufacturing company, leverages the power of place to offer a comprehensive portfolio of workplace, healthcare, and education products, furnishings and services to serve the world s leading organizations.
Founded in 1912, our client is the global leader in enhancing how people work, heal, and learn.

Requirements

Bachelor s Degree -highly preferred.
Able to produce short term fixes and fighting fires on the line, may be involved in long term projects as well.
Able to make cost effective improvements that have a return in the investment in a short time frame.
Able to go to Suppliers (for machinery and consumables) and work with them to meet requirements and deadlines.
A cohesive partnership with skill trades.
Able to listen to what concerns production has and custom the improvement to fit their needs.

Self-driven

Description

Floor Support:

Provides timely product and process support for a manufacturing area to diagnose problems and implement solutions to minimize interruptions in production.

New Product Introductions:

Serves as a manufacturing representative for the implementation of new products into the plant.
Assures that the new products meet cost/profit targets, which are implemented per schedules and on budget, and they conform to manufacturing capabilities.
Establishes economical processes for new products by working with other technical areas.
Evaluates whether to make or purchase parts/products.

Improvements:

Evaluates manufacturing processes to ensure optimal labor and material costs to increase productivity and profitability.
Through justifications and evaluations, identifies prime areas for improvement.
Tracks expenditures to ensure outlays are within budgeted amounts.
Identifies, reduces, and eliminates worker exposure(s) to ergonomic stress in the work place.

Special Projects:

Team member in the implementation of significant product, process or other corporate change initiatives being introduced into the plant

The successful candidate will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States.

WATCH YOUR CUSTOMERS GROW  ALONG WITH YOUR CAREER  Small to medium-sized business owners are ready for tech-based solutions that give them an edge-and that's exactly what you'll offer as a Business Account Executive for Comcast Business Services.
Our integrated suite of Internet, phone, Ethernet and TV products and services are tailor-made for up-and-coming businesses in every type of industry.
So you're not just selling; you're collaborating and playing an active role in your customers' future success.
You'll be listening and effectively responding to client challenges in this customer-facing outside sales role as you create the right bundle of products and services to help each unique customer.

Other responsibilities include generating new sales leads largely in person with some communication over the phone; creating/delivering compelling sales presentations to your prospects; and developing partnerships/affiliations with local organizations.

As you grow your business via client referrals and canvassing your territory, you'll become an expert on the local competitive landscape; and be able to meet or exceed your sales goals, objectives and business relationships.
We'll provide in-depth and ongoing training on the full range of Comcast products and services to ensure your success.
In return you'll bring strong persuasive, negotiation and follow-up skills to the mix, along with a proven ability to successfully close a sale.
A high school diploma or the equivalent is required; a bachelor's degree and 1-2 years of related sales experience is preferred.
If you'd enjoy being part of a close-knit, results-driven team with exceptional potential for growth, we'd like to hear from you.
To learn more about this and other exciting opportunities, use the link below to review the full job description, including experience requirements, and complete an application.

United Tissue Resources is now hiring a Donor Services Director.
As the Donor Services Director you will be responsible for:   Providing direction and oversight for operations.
Planning and executing initiatives.
Enhancing and increasing donation outcomes.
Fostering partner relationships.
Performing assessment of department performance, and setting budgetary goals.

Education requirements



Bachelors degree in Healthcare, Business or Bio-engineering required; some graduate level courses in management preferred.

Experience requirements



Minimum of 5-7 years of management experience.
Must have strong experience with budgetary control processes.

Qualifications



Must be at least 21 years of age.
Must have a valid Texas drivers license, proof of insurance, and an acceptable driving record.
A current licensed RN, PA-c or CSFA is preferred.
Must be CTBS certified or test during the next available exam cycle.
Must be team-oriented with the ability to lead by example.
Must have strong computer skills and knowledge.
Strong working knowledge of databases and Microsoft Office software.
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple, complex projects simultaneously.

Responsibilities



Oversee and direct Tissue Donor Services operations including development of goals and objectives designed to enhance and increase donation and recovery of allograft tissues.
Direct marketing, forecasting and monitoring of donor service relationships with donation and processing partners to further continued development.
Develop and implement strategies to increase tissue donation service areas.
Work closely with the COO regarding strategic business planning, budget and profitability targets.
Provide Executive Management with analysis reports for trends in donor services market.
Operational oversight and collaboration with Accounting department for accounts payables and receivables.
Oversight of Tissue Donor Services operations outcomes in family services, surgical recovery, donor records, partner/hospital development and quality processes including training programs.
Manage contract development, negotiation, and execution for services provided by and to Tissue Donor Services.
Provide leadership and direction for reporting staff in evaluating, coaching, and counseling employees.
Provide departmental SME guidance for operational compliance with applicable industry standards, local, state and federal laws and regulations.

Ensure that the highest levels of service and professionalism are exhibited throughout the organization and provide oversight to messaging that is distributed in the community or to donation partners.
Ensure and maintain the highest levels of customer service for internal and external customers at all times.

Skills



Ability to make sound judgements and decisions.
Ability to meet assigned timeline tasks as required.
Ability to handle difficult situations and deal with sensitive and highly confidential information.
Ability to work independently to meet deadlines and timetables.
Ability to assimilate information and draw reasonable conclusions.
Overnight travel may be required for this position.

SYLVAN IN-HOME TUTORING We are looking for K-12 tutors to join our Sylvan In-Home Tutoring program Experience the difference and become part of our exclusive community of high-quality Sylvan In- Home tutors.
Are you looking to get started as a private tutor or grow your existing tutoring business?

If you are a passionate, enthusiastic, skilled tutor who wants to work with K-12 students we have families looking for Sylvan tutors NOW We also have our proven and proprietary Sylvan Method we are offering as an option to trained Sylvan In-Home tutors for the first time ever.
Our students who use this Method show 2-3x more academic growth than school alone, and we want to help more kids by providing access to our tools through tutors like you.
We want to help more kids and make an impact.
Why should you become a Sylvan In-Home tutor?

Sylvan In-Home offers easy-to-use, online resources and teaching tools that make managing all aspects of your tutoring business a cinch so that you can focus on what you love the most.helping kids As a Sylvan In-Home tutor, you'll get to: - Access to our exclusive digital learning platform, hundreds of hours of content and practice tests and our proven Sylvan Method (Kids in our centers show 2-3x more growth in reading and math) - Establish your own rates and keep more of the income you earn because our commissions are the lowest in the industry bar none - Provide your students with 1:1 tutoring at mutually convenient locations such as their home or a public library - Create and maintain your online tutor profile and have your own unique profile url so you can market yourself in other ways - Set your own availability so that you can tutor when it works for you (and maintain it on the website) - Utilize the Sylvan In-Home website and mobile app to maintain your calendar/schedule, receive payments directly into your bank account, accept/decline session requests and communicate with your families - And much more What do we look for in Sylvan In-Home tutors?
At Sylvan, we believe education is everything, great teachers matter, and that a child's future depends on a solid education and a love of learning.
Being a Sylvan tutor means you're part of the legacy and 40- year reputation of being a trusted, recognized brand that has helped kids succeed in over 600 locations worldwide.
That's why we want the best and the brightest, first- class tutors who share our passion.

The ideal Sylvan In-Home candidate has the following necessary qualifications: - A Bachelor's Degree (preferably one that relates to the type of tutoring you'd like to offer) - Although not required to apply, previous or current state teaching certification is a plus - Demonstrated background or experience in the subject you are tutoring - Successful completion of a phone interview - Successfully pass a background check Start inspiring a love of learning and building confidence in students now.
APPLY TODAY.
Facebook is seeking an experienced leader to manage, execute and collaborate on the company's Election Integrity and Civic Engagement efforts for the Public Policy team.
This role will work with our internal product teams on developing and executing new products in the elections and governance space as well as serve as an external spokesperson about our efforts.
It is a global position that will work in elections across the world.

The Government and Politics Policy team is an external arm of Facebook that helps to manage the company's strategy on elections as well as works with the world's governments and politicians on how to best use Facebook to connect with their constituents.

Headquartered in Lynchburg, Va., BWX Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:BWXT) is a leading supplier of nuclear components and fuel to the U.S. government; provides technical and management services to support the U.S. government in the operation of complex facilities and environmental remediation activities; and supplies precision manufactured components, services and fuel for the commercial nuclear power industry.
With approximately 6,100 employees, BWXT has nine major operating sites in the U.S. and Canada.
In addition, BWXT joint ventures provide management and operations at a dozen U.S. Department of Energy and two NASA facilities.
Follow us on Twitter @BWXTech and learn more at www.bwxt.com.

Project Superintendent (Operations) - BWSR - West Mifflin, PA

BWSR, LLC is a BWXT-led partnership serving as the Decontamination, Decommissioning, and Demolition (D&D) sub-contractor at the Naval Nuclear Laboratory in West Mifflin, PA, and performs the remediation of legacy nuclear and environmental materials on site.

The main project areas at the site include remediation of historical research facilities, demolition of buildings, and characterization of site-infrastructure to support on-going maintenance and construction.

Position Summary

This position is an exempt Management position responsible for day-to-day decontamination and dispositioning operations.

In order to maintain consistent application of resources, this person must work closely as a team member with the Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Radiological Controls, and Project Management organizations to accomplish Company and customer goals.
This person must communicate well in both oral and written forms, performing simple operations on a personal computer in support of work, and may also serve as a trainer and mentor.

Specific duties include, but are not limited to:

Provides Managerial oversight and leadership for all field personnel to ensure the highest safety, environmental, radiological and operational standards are maintained.
Coordinates and supervises Operations Supervisors.
Assigns appropriate operations supervision and personnel support to specific tasks.
Monitors training status of operations personnel to ensure qualified and trained personnel are available for scheduled tasks.
Reviews Technical Work Documents (TWDs) in support of D&D work.
Responsible for daily administrative, employee relations and team building for the Operations organization.
Participates in employee reviews, merit advancements, and personnel investigations.
Makes recommendations regarding disciplinary actions for the Operations organization.
Ensures the work force is adequately supplied with materials and equipment.
Responsible for Management follow of progress of D&D work efforts, keeping upper line management informed on the status of jobs.
Ensures safety, environmental controls, radiological controls, productivity and individual training and work practices at the job site are commensurate with requirements.
Audits work in progress to assure compliance with established procedures.
Participates in employment interviews and makes hiring recommendations.
May be required to act as alternate Operations Manager as needed.

Job Qualifications / Requirements

A Bachelor's degree with a minimum of five years  experience in the area of radiological and environmental D&D work.
Experience with the Naval Reactors (NR) program is strongly preferred.
Equivalent education and/or training plus job related experience may be considered.
A preponderance of NR D&D experience may be substituted for the educational requirement upon customer approval.
Must be physically qualified to perform duties of the job description.
Must be able to obtain and maintain qualification as a radiological contamination worker.
Must be familiar with Microsoft Office and be able to produce reports, presentations, and communications as requested.
Must be able to obtain and maintain Respirator qualifications.
Must be able to obtain and maintain Hazardous Waste Generator/Transporter qualifications.
Must be able to secure and maintain a DOE  L  Clearance.
US Citizenship, with no dual citizenship is required for this position.
Applicants selected will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter.

Position requires U.S. Citizenship with (no dual citizenship) ability to obtain and maintain a Department of Energy (DOE) security clearance which involves an extensive criminal and financial background investigation, drug test and previous employment reference verifications.

Chamberlain University is experiencing continued growth, and we are looking to add colleagues to our Admissions team.
This position will support admissions for one of our post-licensure or graduate nursing degree programs.
Are you curious about people and finding out about their goals and motivations in life?
Do you believe that continuing education can positively impact a person s life?
Are you good at creating relationships, listening, and helping others reach their education and career goals?
Do you enjoy working in a team atmosphere, while also having accountability for your own accomplishments?
If you answered  Yes  to these questions, and have prior experience in recruitment, marketing, client services or consulting, the admissions advisor role might be the career for you!
Our admissions advisors are the first point of contact for prospective students, so we are looking for engaging, warm, enthusiastic people who will quickly create meaningful relationships.
We hire colleagues who are passionate about the value of higher education, and who want to help our students take the first step in continuing their education.
Flexible work arrangements/work from home is available after 6 months if in good standing.

Completes certification process and associated training to develop broad admissions knowledge
The role of the admissions advisor is to reach out to individuals via phone, or through video conferencing, take incoming calls and place outbound calls to prospective students in a call center team environment.

Admissions advisors interview prospective students to determine their motivation for attending college; understand their career goals and the obstacles that might prevent them from starting or continuing their education; help them to overcome those obstacles; and ultimately help them identify the degree-program that best matches their needs.
During the interview advisors present information about the benefits of education and Chamberlain University, tailoring their message to the student s needs, motivation, and career goals.

Once prospective students decide to enroll, advisors guide them through the admissions process, responding to questions, linking them to financial aid and academic advisors, gathering the documents necessary to start school, and ensuring students complete admissions testing.
By networking and building relationships with their students, admissions advisors identify and contact other prospective students.

Successful admissions advisors will:

Have a Bachelor s Degree or equivalent relevant experience required.
Have a passion for education and the desire to help prospective students achieve their educational and career goals.
Enjoy listening to, and talking with prospective students over the phone, getting to know them, and creating a meaningful relationship.
Possess the skills needed to craft well-written, compelling messages to our students and fellow colleagues.
Have the desire to work with a team, and toward the team s goals, while also working independently and being internally motivated.

Work with other engineers as a team member to solve multi-disciplinary problems.
Interface with program office and government customer.
Work may involve system level analysis such as signal propagation, RF system performance, requirements development and review.
Potential for broad range of problems and need to have willingness to learn and tackle new problems.

A minimum of 8 years of experience post bachelor degree (graduate school counts as experience)Extensive knowledge of digital signal processing.

Experience programming FPGAs or GPUs.
Experience working in an electronics laboratory environment.

Job Description:Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) has an exciting opportunity for a Configuration Management (CM) Analyst in Aurora, CO.
Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at a state of the art facility in Colorado?
Then join our Raytheon team of engineers solving problems that make the world a safer place and help to secure our great nation!
Come support those who provide us with all the freedoms we enjoy.
Our facility in Aurora, CO offers amenities that create work and life balance.
On site we have a 24/7 fitness facility, health center, cafeteria, collaboration rooms and dynamic break areas for easy conversation and socialization.
Additionally, we provide employee appreciation lunches, bonus opportunities, and great benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401K match, flexible work schedule - just to name a few.
Click here to view a brief video and learn more: Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) has an exciting opportunity for a Configuration Management (CM) Analyst in Aurora, CO.

As a Configuration Management (CM) Analyst, you will be supporting engineering programs that will support the management and control of configurations and baselines, ensuring complete traceability of changes through a documented change management process.

With a focus on Hardware Configuration Items (HWCIs), tasks include configuration identification, configuration control, configuration status accounting, data management, product release and delivery, and configuration audits.
Track and process hardware drawings and engineering change notices.
Create/improve CM processes related to HW CM.
Facilitate Configuration Change Control Boards and provide CM assessments and inputs to engineering change requests.
Interface with all engineering disciplines and program management.

We are The Boston Beer Company.
We brew the best beer.
We hire the best people.
We are always eager to find competitive, motivated, hardworking people who love beer and want to join our team.
We work hard and we play hard.

We are currently hiring for our next Materials Coordinator in Cincinnati, OH.

The Materials Coordinator is responsible for procuring all raw materials involved in the brewing and the packaging processes; monitoring quality and maintaining inventory control of these materials; communicating guidelines, issues, and education to departments using these materials; and sustaining vendor relations related to quality, service, and other communications.
This position will also cross train with the Production Planner and Logistics Facilitator positions in order to support the scheduling function and shipping/receiving activities.
What You'll Do:    Plan, purchase, and schedule delivery of all packaging and brewing raw materials.
Revise these orders as necessary based on production schedules.
Create truck schedule based on packaging material releases.
Distribute these schedules as well as revisions to appropriate department supervisors and appropriate operators.
Create incoming raw materials spreadsheet based on brewing material releases.
Manage perpetual inventory control of raw materials.
Organize monthly and yearly physical counts with the Accounting department.
Analyze inventory variances and implement preventative solutions.
Generate material defect reports.
Report to appropriate parties involved.
Coordinate new product and/or graphics introductions and promotional items with Packaging Department as requested by BBC.
Create planned production for bottling and kegging in SAP.
Make changes as necessary.
Maintain Production Orders spreadsheet in Excel.
Enter receipts for all packaging and brewing raw materials into SAP in a timely and precise manner.
Follow up with vendor if there are discrepancies in deliveries.
Visit vendors and acquire a technical understanding of their manufacturing/QC processes as well as their products that are used as our raw materials.
Provide feedback to vendors at all times on customer service, product quality, cost-saving ideas, and other relevant information.
Maintain team atmosphere of SABC's relationship with suppliers.
Cross train with Production Planner in developing and maintaining brewing, kegging, and bottling schedules.
Offer back-up as necessary.
Cross train with Logistics Facilitator in managing shipping/receiving activities including generating bills of lading and managing all of the associated paperwork flow.
Help identify cost savings opportunities such as reducing waste and streamlining processes.
What We're Looking For:    Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or a management related field.
Computer proficiency in SAP & Microsoft Office applications.
Must have the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and work well in high-pressure situations.
Good interpersonal and team skills.
Proactive approach to anticipating issues and migrating risks as early as possible.
Should be a strong, analytical problem solver with a common sense and practical solution orientation.
Should be able to contribute on a strategic level as well as the ability to work tactically by getting involved at the plant level and in the execution of projects.
Excellent communication skills, creativity, flexibility and determination are requirements for success in this position.
Some Perks:  Our people are our most important ""ingredient.""
We not only have to hire the best, but we have to reward, develop, and retain them too.

We also have a variety of benefits including a competitive compensation package, extensive training programs, excellent healthcare, a discounted stock purchase plan, and a 401K program with a generous company match.
Not to mention, there's the free beer too!
Boston Beer Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse workforce.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Services Specialist will utilize child welfare practice skills to ensure children are protected from abuse and neglect.
When child abuse or neglect is indicated, specialists work closely with families and the legal system toward a goal of reunification, independent living, or other permanent living situation.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES MAY INCLUDE:



Assessing allegations of child abuse or neglect and taking necessary steps to protect children.
This could mean removing a child from a family.
Developing working relationships with people who strongly dislike DHHS because of their personal history or the reputation of child protective agencies in general.
Learning about cultures, traditions, and lifestyles different from your own and developing cultural competencies to understand how to determine child safety and well-being within that context.
Comprehending the impact of historical trauma, and observing protocols of differing cultures.
Maintaining objectivity and empathy for families living in stressful situations.
Preparing comprehensive and accurate court documents.
Testifying in court, including defending your actions which will be questioned by defense attorneys and other parties to the case.
Working under deadlines that require prioritizing efforts with constant pressure created by the nature and volume of the cases, documentation and working flexible hours.
This position may be required to work evenings, weekends, and other non-standard work hours as needed and could be placed on a rotating on-call roster.

The Project Manager functions as the Manager for construction projects, working directly with superintendents, foremen, the estimating department, as well as office support to ensure construction projects are completed on time and under budget.
The Project Manager is the cornerstone of Capitol Valley Electric Management Team!

Responsibilities and Duties

Ensures that all assigned work is completed on time and within budget.
Follow all CVE procedures for setting up and running projects.

The Project Manager is tasked with ensuring a high level of client satisfaction is maintained
